content:
ReferenceList Class

In this Article

Represents the <ReferenceList> element used in XML encryption. This class cannot be inherited.

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class ReferenceList : System.Collections.IList

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • ReferenceList

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

The ReferenceList class represents the <ReferenceList> element of an encrypted document XML signature defined by the XML encryption specification.

The ReferenceList class contains references to EncryptedData and EncryptedKey elements that were encrypted by a key contained within another EncryptedKey element. The ReferenceList class uses DataReference elements to reference EncryptedData elements, and KeyReference elements to reference EncryptedKey elements.

You can add only DataReference or KeyReference objects to the ReferenceList collection.

For more information about XML encryption standards, see http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlenc-core.

Constructors summary

ReferenceList()

Initializes a new instance of the ReferenceList class.

Properties summary

Count

Gets the number of elements contained in the ReferenceList object.
IsSynchronized

Gets a value that indicates whether access to the ReferenceList object is synchronized (thread safe).
ItemOf(Int32)

Gets or sets the DataReference or KeyReference object at the specified index.
SyncRoot

Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the ReferenceList object.

Methods summary

Add(Object)

Adds a DataReference or KeyReference object to the ReferenceList collection.
Clear()

Removes all items from the ReferenceList collection.
Contains(Object)

Determines whether the ReferenceList collection contains a specific DataReference or KeyReference object.
CopyTo(Array,Int32)

Copies the elements of the ReferenceList object to an array, starting at a specified array index.
GetEnumerator()

Returns an enumerator that iterates through a ReferenceList collection.
IndexOf(Object)

Determines the index of a specific item in the ReferenceList collection.
Insert(Int32,Object)

Inserts a DataReference or KeyReference object into the ReferenceList collection at the specified position.
Item(Int32)

Returns the DataReference or KeyReference object at the specified index.
Remove(Object)

Removes the first occurrence of a specific DataReference or KeyReference object from the ReferenceList collection.
RemoveAt(Int32)

Removes the DataReference or KeyReference object at the specified index.

Explicit Interface Implementations summary

IList.IsFixedSize

For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.IsFixedSize*.
IList.IsReadOnly

For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.IsReadOnly*.
IList.Item(Int32)

For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.Item*.

Constructors

  • ReferenceList()

    Initializes a new instance of the ReferenceList class.

    public ReferenceList ();

Properties

  • Count

    Gets the number of elements contained in the ReferenceList object.

    public int Count { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The number of elements contained in the ReferenceList object.

  • IsSynchronized

    Gets a value that indicates whether access to the ReferenceList object is synchronized (thread safe).

    public bool IsSynchronized { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if access to the ReferenceList object is synchronized (thread safe); otherwise, false.

  • ItemOf(Int32)

    Gets or sets the DataReference or KeyReference object at the specified index.

    public System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedReference this[int index] { get; set; }

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The index of the DataReference or KeyReference object to return.

    Property Value

    • EncryptedReference

      The ReferenceList object at the specified index.

  • SyncRoot

    Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the ReferenceList object.

    public object SyncRoot { get; }

    Property Value

    • System.Object

      An object that can be used to synchronize access to the ReferenceList object.

Methods

  • Add(Object)

    Adds a DataReference or KeyReference object to the ReferenceList collection.

    public int Add (object value);

    Parameters

    • value
      System.Object

      A DataReference or KeyReference object to add to the ReferenceList collection.

    Returns

    • Int32

      The position at which the new element was inserted.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      The value parameter is not a DataReference object.

      -or-

      The value parameter is not a KeyReference object.

    • ArgumentNullException

      The value parameter is null.

  • Clear()

    Removes all items from the ReferenceList collection.

    public void Clear ();
  • Contains(Object)

    Determines whether the ReferenceList collection contains a specific DataReference or KeyReference object.

    public bool Contains (object value);

    Parameters

    • value
      System.Object

      The DataReference or KeyReference object to locate in the ReferenceList collection.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the DataReference or KeyReference object is found in the ReferenceList collection; otherwise, false.

  • CopyTo(Array,Int32)

    Copies the elements of the ReferenceList object to an array, starting at a specified array index.

    public void CopyTo (Array array, int index);

    Parameters

    • array
      Array

      The one-dimensional Array object that is the destination of the elements copied from the ReferenceList object. The array must have zero-based indexing.

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.

  • GetEnumerator()

    Returns an enumerator that iterates through a ReferenceList collection.

    public System.Collections.IEnumerator GetEnumerator ();

    Returns

    • IEnumerator

      An IEnumerator object that can be used to iterate through a ReferenceList collection.

    Remarks

    Enumerators allow only reading the data in the collection. Enumerators cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.

  • IndexOf(Object)

    Determines the index of a specific item in the ReferenceList collection.

    public int IndexOf (object value);

    Parameters

    • value
      System.Object

      The DataReference or KeyReference object to locate in the ReferenceList collection.

    Returns

    • Int32

      The index of value if found in the collection; otherwise, -1.

  • Insert(Int32,Object)

    Inserts a DataReference or KeyReference object into the ReferenceList collection at the specified position.

    public void Insert (int index, object value);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index at which value should be inserted.

    • value
      System.Object

      A DataReference or KeyReference object to insert into the ReferenceList collection.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      The value parameter is not a DataReference object.

      -or-

      The value parameter is not a KeyReference object.

    • ArgumentNullException

      The value parameter is null.

  • Item(Int32)

    Returns the DataReference or KeyReference object at the specified index.

    public System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedReference Item (int index);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The index of the DataReference or KeyReference object to return.

    Returns

    • EncryptedReference

      The DataReference or KeyReference object at the specified index.

  • Remove(Object)

    Removes the first occurrence of a specific DataReference or KeyReference object from the ReferenceList collection.

    public void Remove (object value);

    Parameters

    • value
      System.Object

      The DataReference or KeyReference object to remove from the ReferenceList collection.

  • RemoveAt(Int32)

    Removes the DataReference or KeyReference object at the specified index.

    public void RemoveAt (int index);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index of the DataReference or KeyReference object to remove.

Explicit Interface Implementations

  • IList.IsFixedSize

    For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.IsFixedSize*.

    bool System.Collections.IList.IsFixedSize { get; }

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the IList has a fixed size; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the ReferenceList instance is cast to an IList interface.

  • IList.IsReadOnly

    For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.IsReadOnly*.

    bool System.Collections.IList.IsReadOnly { get; }

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the IList is read-only; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the ReferenceList instance is cast to an IList interface.

  • IList.Item(Int32)

    For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.Item*.

    object System.Collections.IList.Item[int index] { get; set; }

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index of the element to get or set.

    Returns

    • System.Object

      The element at the specified index.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      index is not a valid index in the IList.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the ReferenceList instance is cast to an IList interface.
